ygData.subject: Re: Heritrix pauses at seemingly random intervals
ygData.msgSnippet: Hrm, I don t think that anything serious could happen in the css parser, but I could always be surprised. I was also running into OOM errors, but that was due

Hrm, I don't think that anything serious could happen in the css parser, bu=
t I could always be surprised. I was also running into OOM errors, but that=
 was due to how I was buffering things.
Thanks!


--- In archive-crawler@ya=
hoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> Ah, well, the fact that=
 your try/catch(Exception) doesn't catch it, that
> ToeThread.seriousError(=
) ends up being called, and also the name of the
> class, all suggest that =
com.phloc.css.parser.TokenMgrError is a
> java.lang.Error.
> 
> "An Error i=
s a subclass of Throwable that indicates serious problems that a
> reasonab=
le application should not try to catch."
> 
> http://docs.oracle.com/javase=
/6/docs/api/java/lang/Error.html
> 
> That library really should not be thr=
owing Error in this case. I don't see
> the class here, so maybe they reali=
zed that and changed it, and maybe a
> newer version of the library wouldn'=
t have the problem.
> https://code.google.com/p/phloc-css/source/browse/#sv=
n%2Ftrunk%2Fphloc-css%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Fcom%2Fphloc%2Fcss%2Fparser
> 
>=
 In the mean time you could add a catch(TokenMgrError) clause to your try
>=
 block. (You could also catch(Throwable) but that could cause problems
> be=
cause you want to let real errors like OutOfMemoryError through).
> 
> Noah=

> 
>
